summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the submission of an unredacted reply memorandum in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application in her criminal case. The emails discuss sharing an expert letter with the Office of International Affairs (OIA) and contain a notice from defense counsel about office closure due to COVID-19.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who is submitting the unredacted reply memorandum in support of Maxwell's bail application and apologizing for a computer glitch.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in case 20 Cr. 330 (AJN/MN) whose bail application is being supported by the submitted memorandum.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Recipient of the email from Bobbi Sternheim regarding the submission under seal, likely a member of the judge's chambers.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on the email chain regarding the Maxwell case submission, suggesting involvement as a prosecutor.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Listed as a recipient on the email chain regarding the Maxwell case submission, suggesting involvement as a prosecutor.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Mentioned at the end of the document text, likely another attorney involved in the Maxwell defense team.

connections.description: Sternheim is submitting legal documents on behalf of Maxwell in support of her bail application.
Both appear to be part of the defense legal team for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Both are prosecutors on the email chain discussing the Maxwell case submission.
Sternheim is communicating with court chambers staff regarding case submissions.

events.title: Submission of Bail Reply Memorandum
events.description: Bobbi Sternheim submits an unredacted reply memorandum in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's pending bail application to be filed under seal.

locations: West 19th Street office (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, New York)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team submitted an unredacted reply memorandum supporting her bail application on March 16, 2021.
Prosecutors discussed sharing an "expert" letter with the Office of International Affairs (OIA) for their assessment.
Bobbi Sternheim's law office was closed due to COVID-19 but operating remotely during this period.
The document shows ongoing legal proceedings in Maxwell's case (20 Cr. 330) regarding bail matters.
Multiple prosecutors (Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca) and defense attorneys (Bobbi Sternheim, Laura Menninger) were involved in the correspondence.
